concept.title: Symptoms of Drawband or Mainspring Failure
concept.shortdesc: Common indicators that suggest a malfunction in the drawband or mainspring of a typewriter

conbody.p: If the carriage movement stalls, stops altogether, or loses tension, the problem usually indicates that the drawband or mainspring is not functioning properly. These symptoms suggest a loss of energy transfer within the typewriterâ€™s carriage mechanism, requiring further inspection to determine the cause.
